profileAlternative.name: Jason Turner
profileAlternative.headline: C++ Trainer, Speaker, and Developer
profileAlternative.summary:
Jason is an internationally known, award winning, C++ keynote speaker and trainer. He has spoken and provided training across the United States, Poland, Germany, Netherlands, United Kingdom and New Zealand at more than 10 conferences and 15 companies. Jason utilizes his 2 decades of C++ knowledge and unique training style to help organizations write clean, maintainable, and efficient programs.

Aside from his speaking and training activities, Jason is an active member of the C++ community as co-host of a C++ podcast, CppCast. He is also host of C++ Weekly, a YouTube channel publishing a new video at least once a week since March, 2016. His YouTube channel has over 20 thousand subscribers and more than 1 million views. In recognition of his contributions to the C++ community he has been awarded as a Microsoft MVP since 2015.

Jason is available for training, speaking, code reviews, and contracting services and he currently has 2 O'Reilly published C++ video series available on Safari Online.

positions.title: Independent Business Owner
positions.description: I provide C++ related consulting services; including training, speaking and code reviews to organizations around the world.

positions.title: Podcast Host
positions.description: Co-host of CppCast, a podcast for C++ developers, by C++ developers.

positions.title: Staff Writer
positions.description: Reviewed adventure games with a focus on freeware adventure games.

positions.title: Security Engineer
positions.description: Developed a massively parallel distributed system used for network inventory collection and command and control facilities.

positions.title: Engineer
positions.description:
Built a distributed IP based audio system as part of a small team. Learned the principles and practicalities of distributed computing.

Designed and implemented a system for passing of live streaming infrared remote control signals over ethernet. Responsible for hardware specification and implementation of software both at the Linux operating system level and the microcontroller level, for the real time processing that needed to occur.
…
see more

positions.title: Senior Programmer
positions.description: Participated in reimplementation of the Colorado Department of Labor's unemployment insurance system which was being developed in VisualBasic.NET.

positions.title: Programmer
positions.companyName: Community Health Plan of the Rockies
positions.description: Developed in-house imaging and workflow system used for the processing of medical claims.

positions.title: Developer
positions.description: Integrated and developed secure commercial document delivery solutions using a wide variety of technologies.

positions.title: Software Developer
positions.description: Worked as a summer intern as part of a small team developing a Java based order entry system.

given.text:
Working in fast paced, potentially high stress design and production environment it was a joy to work with Jason. He provided consistent, level headed critique and feedback, and helped me understand the relevant (and often complicated) technical details associated with the projects that we collaborated on, all of which inevitably resulted in on-time, accurate and successful deliverables... And always in a manner that was fun and encouraging! Great collaborator, great attitude...
…
See more

Jason is one of the brightest and most talented engineers I have had the opportunity to work with. Jason is an expert in his domain, very dedicated and very focused. Truly a valued and contributing member of any team he is on. I look forward to the opportunity to work with him again.

During my time working with Jason, he was a hard working and dedicated employee, who always went the extra mile. He had an amazing problem solving ability to get to the root cause of an issue and resolve it. It would be a pleasure to work along side him again.

In all of my years as a technology professional, I've never known anyone with the passion and aptitude for programming that Jason has. He has the capacity to understand complex problems and implement code to solve them in a way that only the most skilled programmers I know can.

received.text: Jim is the creative thinker you can always count on to bounce ideas off of and to give you feedback as to which direction you should examine or pursue next in your project.

Richard quickly picked up on and addressed the needs that we, the software engineers, had when creating the graphics for an embedded touch screen device.

His creativity and attention to detail is unparalleled and made the products we built truly shine.

items: ChaiScript Embedded Scripting Language for C++
Touchscreen Interface for Vibe Audio System
Best Presentation - constexpr ALL The Things
Most Useful Presentation: Practical Performance Practices

peopleAlsoViewed.text: PhD student, DeepLearning with High-Performance-Computing systems
Technical Fellow and Managing Director at Morgan Stanley
Senior Staff Software Engineer at Google
